thread.title: Top 100 plants: Autumn

author: Val Bourne
title: Top 100 plants: Autumn
text: Spring Summer Winter Autumn Daisies are everywhere, but it's important to add contrasts in this jewel-box season. 1 Orpine 'Purple Emperor' ( Sedum telephium) Flat heads of tiny ruby-red stars held on strong stems and supported by neatly crimped, chocolate-purple foliage. Accommodating (50cm/20in). 2 Sneezeweed 'Sahin's Early Flowerer' (Helenium) Shimmering orange daisies with brown velvet centres lift the border. Deadhead for repeat flowers. Good soil (1m/3ft). Helenium 'Sahin's Early Flowerer' Picture: Marianne Majerus 3 Aster 'Little Carlow' Sprays of small lavender-blue daisies throb in late summer and autumn, particularly in evening light. Sun and good soil (1.2m/4ft). Aster cordifolius Little Carlow Picture: Alamy 4 Michalmas daisy 'Mönch' (Aster x frikartii) The longest flowering aster of all, with good foliage and large violet-blue daisies on slightly lax stems. Sun and good soil (90cm/3ft). 5 Sunflower 'Lemon Queen' (Helianthus) Tall, self-supporting and non-spreading perennial sunflower. Sun or part sun (1.75m/6ft). Sunflower 'Lemon Queen' Picture: Alamy 6 Coneflower 'Goldsturm' ( Rudbeckia fulgida) Slick and smart, these neatly rayed golden daisies are dark-eyed and persist from July until October. Sun, good soil (90cm/3ft). Coneflower 'Goldsturm' Picture: Alamy 7 Hardy garden verbena (Verbena rigida) Low-growing, with vivid purple flowers and a branching candelabra habit. Stays in flower for months. Sun, good drainage (30cm/1ft). 8 Chinese plumbago ( Ceratostigma willmottianum) Wiry, tall wands of gentian-blue phlox-shaped flowers continue until November against reddish foliage. Warm sun (90cm/3ft). 9 Red-hot poker 'Tawny King' (Kniphofia) A mixture of maple syrup and cream on this long-flowering poker that delivers in flushes. Sun and moist soil (1.2m/4ft). Red-hot poker 'Tawny King' Picture: Features Scan 10 Oriental fountain grass (Pennisetum orientale) Slender beige caterpillars make pinks and purples appear brighter and add movement to the border. Good drainage (90cm/3ft). 11 Miscanthus sinensis 'Silberfeder' Delivers across Britain whatever the weather (unlike some), producing tall, silver plumes on stiff stems by August. Fades well. Good soil (2.4m/8ft). 12 White gaura (Gaura lindheimeri) Wands of delicate apple blossom-white flowers open slowly and keep the show going until November. Good drainage (1m/3ft). 13 Penstemon 'Hidcote Pink' Refined spires of tubular, rose-pink flowers, etched with white and overlaid with cerise, elevate this tough penstemon into the super league. Sun (25cm/10in). 14 Monk's hood 'Arendsii' (Aconitum carmichaelii) Thick, grey-green stems and sumptuous dark foliage followed by tall September and October spires of sapphire-blue flowers. Sun or shade (1.25m/4ft). 15 Smoke tree Royal Purple ( Cotinus coggygria) When temperatures plummet, the wine-red lollipop leaves fleck with shocking pink. Accommodating (5m/16ft). 16 Japanese Anemone 'Honorine Jobert' ( Anemone x hybrida) Classic Japanese anemone with single white flowers bossed in gold, and dark green foliage - good in deep shade. Any soil, but not too wet (1.2m/4ft). Japanese Anemone 'Honorine Jobert' Picture: Alamy 17 Anise-scented sage 'Black and Blue' (Salvia guaranitica) Foot-long tapering spikes of navy blue tubular flowers held in black cases. Good drainage and sun (2.5m/8ft). 18 Argentinian vervain (Verbena bonariensis) Self-supporting, slender with stems topped with lavender butterfly magnets. Sun (2m/6ft). 19 Bergamot 'Squaw' (Monarda) Brash scarlet flowers make this robust grower a show-stopper in September. The black pepper-pot seedheads last through winter too. Sun, humus-rich soil (1.2m/4ft). 20 Dahlia 'David Howard' Soft orange, smoky-leaved dahlia. Indispensable in warm-toned borders. Sun (75cm/30in). Dahlia 'David Howard' Picture: Clive Nichols 21 Montbretia 'Severn Sunrise' ( Crocosmia) A late crocosmia with shot-silk, shimmering copper-tinted flowers that fade to pink. Sun and summer moisture (1m/3ft). 22 Coneflower 'Magnus' (Echinacea purpurea) A flat-petalled reddish pink daisy with golden-brown centre. Sun and good soil (1m/3ft). 23 Sedge ( Carex testacea) A swirling optic-fibre lamp of soft, olive-green filaments, touched with orange highlights, on this year-round grass. Well-drained soil (40cm/16in). Carex testacea Picture: Features scan 24 Flat-stalked spindle tree (Euonymus planipes) The jungly pinnate leaves turn crimson-pink and drop early to reveal orange and crimson spindles on dangling threads. Well-drained soil (2m/6ft). 25 Phlox 'Monica Lynden-Bell' (paniculata) A pale pink, white-eyed fragrant phlox with a robust constitution. Good against asters and in shade. Good soil (75cm/30in). Phlox 'Monica Lynden-Bell' © RHS @telegraph
